result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Majaedo J Certion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Majaedo J Certion not in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Majaedo J Certion.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson for Samuel Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. The Defendant did appear but left prior to the case being called. Attorney Kuehn unable to make contact with the defendant.  The Court sets this matter for adjourned Scheduling Conference and orders the Defendant to appear.  Case adjourned to Br. 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Majaedo J Certion in court with Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 15CF543. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer J. Hermann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Lori Kuehn

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Majaedo J Certion in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/15/22 @ 2p
